data.question: What is the empirical formula of MIT-25?
What method was used for the X-ray diffraction studies?
data.answer: Low-temperature data were collected on a Siemens three-circle diffractometer coupled to a Bruker-APEX CCD detector with graphite-monochromated Mo Kα radiation.

data.question: Is the BET surface area of MIT-25 greater than 800 m2/g?
What is the role of the bridging protons in the coordination environment around each Mg2+ ion in MIT-25?
data.answer: The bridging protons serve both charge-balancing and structural roles.

data.question: What is the crystal system of MIT-26?
Did the synthesis of MIT-26 involve the use of H4TBAPy?
What was the yield of red needle single crystals when synthesizing MIT-25?
Can the organic SBU in MIT-25 accommodate a single hole, evenly delocalized across the three TTF cores?
What was the method used for gas sorption measurements?
data.answer: A Micromeritics ASAP 2020 Surface Area and Porosity Analyzer was used to measure the nitrogen adsorption isotherms.

data.question: What computational method was used to optimize the geometrical structure of the proton for MIT-25?
data.answer: Kohn-Sham density functional theory (DFT) as implemented in the Vienna ab initio simulation package (VASP).

data.question: Does MIT-25 exhibit permanent mesoporosity?
What is the role of π interactions in the formation of MIT-25?
data.answer: π interactions provide stabilization energy that is competitive with the self-assembly of canonical inorganic SBUs, leading to the formation of unusual topologies centered around the organic SBUs.

data.question: Was MIT-26 synthesized using a similar method to MIT-25?
What is the significance of the electrostatic potential method in determining the pore size of MIT-25?
data.answer: The electrostatic potential method provides a chemically accurate estimate of pore aperture by using the tailing of electrostatic potential to plateaus.

data.question: What was the crystal system used for MIT-25?
Is the BET surface area of MIT-25 calculated using the Barrett-Joyner-Halenda (BJH) method?
What was the role of continuous-wave (CW) electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR) spectra in the study of MIT-25?
data.answer: CW EPR spectra were used to elucidate the nature of the charge-compensating species in MIT-25, showing it is paramagnetic.

data.question: What was the purpose of using thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) in the study of MIT-25?
data.answer: TGA was used to determine the temperature for evacuating the crystals of MIT-25 before measuring the N2 adsorption isotherm.

data.question: Was the synthesis of MIT-25 and MIT-26 performed at the same temperature?
What computational detail was unique to the study of the proton locality around the Mg2+ center in MIT-25?
data.answer: A model coordination environment was constructed and optimized using DFT to elucidate the proton locality, showing that bridging protons were integral to the coordination environment.
